utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No-no-no-no, we're done.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Aunt Syl, stop yelling! All I'm saying is that if you had told me vegetarian lasagna, I would have made vegetarian lasagna. Well, the meat's only every third layer, maybe you could scrape.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross, did you really read all these baby books?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yup! You could plunk me down in the middle of any woman's uterus, no compass, and I can find my way out of there like that!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, this is cool...it says in some parts of the world, people actually eat the placenta.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And, we're done with the yogurt.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Aunt Syl, I did this as a favor, I am not a caterer. What do you want me to do with a dozen lasagnas? Nice talk, Aunt Syl. You kiss Uncle Freddie with that mouth?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Ross, listen, you know that right now, your baby's only this big? This is your baby. Hi Daddy!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How come you don't live with Mommy? How come Mommy lives with that other lady? What's a lesbian?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, you can say it, Poconos, Poconos, it's like Poc-o-nos

utterance.content: Ah, poke a nose, mmm

utterance.content: So, did I hear Poconos?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah, it's just a weekend, big deal!

utterance.content: Wasn't this supposed to be just a fling, huh? Shouldn't it be... flung by now?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean, we are way past the fling thing, I mean, I am feeling things that I've only read about in Danielle Steele books, you know? I mean, when I'm with him, I'm totally, totally...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: ...nauseous, I'm physically nauseous. What am I supposed to do, huh? Call immigration? I could call immigration!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I love babies, with their little baby shoes, and their little baby toes, and their little baby hands...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ok, you're going to have to stop that, forever!

utterance.content: Need a new table.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You think?

utterance.content: Hey hey, come on in!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, hello! mmwa! I brought all the books, and Monica sends her love, along with this lasagna.

utterance.content: Oh great! Is it vegetarian, 'cause Susan doesn't eat meat.

utterance.content: I'm pretty sure that it is...

utterance.content: So, I got the results of the amnio today.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Totally and completely healthy!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, that's great, that is great!

utterance.content: Uh, that's our friend Tanya.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Of course it's your friend Tanya.

utterance.content: Don't you want to know about the sex?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The sex? Um, I'm having enough trouble with the image of you and Susan together, when you throw in Tanya , yaw...

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: The sex of the baby, Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, you know the sex of the baby? Oh, oh-oh-oh!

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Do you want to know?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no, I don't want to know, absolutely not. I think, you know, I think you should know until you look down there, and say, oop, there it is! Or isn't...

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Oh, hello Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Susan...

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: So, so, did you hear?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes, we did, everything's A-OK!

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Oh, that's so... It really is...do we know...?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Yes, we certainly do, it's going to be...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, hey hey hey, ho ho ho, hello, guy who doesn't want to know, standing right here!

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Oh, well, is it what we thought it would be?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Mm-hmmm

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ok, what, what...ok, what did we think it was going to be?

utterance.content: It's a...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no, no I don't want to know, don't want to know. Ok, you know, I should probably, I should probably just go.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Well, thanks for the books.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No problem, ok, mmmwa oh, mmmwa Susan...

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: All right, who should we call first, your folks, or Deb and Rona?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, never mind, I don't want to know.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ok, so it's just because it was my table, I have to buy a new one?

utterance.content: That's the rule.

utterance.content: What rule? There's no rule, if anything, you owe me a table!

utterance.speaker: Joey

utterance.content: Ok, ok, How about if we split it?

utterance.content: What do you mean, like, buy it together?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Aw, don't do that

utterance.content: Ok, thanks.

utterance.content: Um, that's really your decision, I mean, some people prefer, you know, to take off...oh whoops! You're being naked!

utterance.content: I can't believe you don't want to know. I mean, I couldn't not know, I mean, if, if the doctor knows, and Carol knows, and Susan knows....

utterance.content: You have to tell her! You have to tell her! It's your moral obligation, as a friend, as a woman, I think it's a feminist issue! Guys? Guys?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ok, um, we haven't known each other for that long a time, and, um, there are three things that you should know about me. One, my friends are the most important thing in my life, two, I never lie, and three, I make the best oatmeal raisin cookies in the world.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ok, thanks Pheebs Oh my God, why have I never tasted these before?!

utterance.content: All right, well, you're right, these are the best oatmeal cookies I've ever had.

utterance.content: No...oh, I feel so stupid! Oh, I think about the other day with you guys and I was all "Oh, Paolo, he's so great, he makes me feel so..." Oh, God, I'm so embarrassed!

utterance.content: Oh, God...

utterance.content: We should get over there and see if she's okay. Just one...second! Score! Game! Come on.

utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.content: Oh...
